item.title: Mapping ESPR Impact: How Zuid-Holland Used Data to Prepare Its Businesses for Digital Product Passports
item.description: The EU's Ecodesign for Sustainable Products Regulation will require Digital Product Passports for a growing number of product categories. Most regional governments have no idea which businesses in their territory will be affected. Zuid-Holland decided to find out — and turned the insights into a funded support program.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: The Construction Innovator Paradox: Why Innovative Construction Products May Face Digital Product Passports First
item.description: Everyone assumes DPP obligations will roll out family by family. But the CPR's two-route CE marking system means innovative products using the EAD/ETA route could face Digital Product Passport requirements years before mainstream products covered by harmonised standards — and there is no way out.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: Smart Charging in the Vruchtenbuurt: How a Residents' Initiative Is Redesigning Energy, Mobility, and Public Space
item.description: In The Hague's Vruchtenbuurt, two energy cooperatives and the municipality used a structured innovation process to untangle a complex challenge: how do you optimally use the electricity grid and public space when residents generate their own energy, share cars, and want a neighbourhood battery? This is the story of how Problem Analysis and Ideation turned a residents' dream into a concrete plan.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: Energy Justice by Design: How We Helped The Hague Design Energy Cooperatives That Changed Local Welfare Policies
item.description: The Hague tested whether solar cooperative revenues from Slim Strandnet could be routed directly to people in need — reducing energy bills without requiring them to join a cooperative. Behind the experiment lies a larger vision: a city-wide social cooperative that ensures energy security and independence for everyone, regardless of whether they can afford a solar panel. Inside the design, the experiment, and what it takes to make the energy transition structurally just.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: A Smart Energy Community on Scheveningen Beach: How a public/private cooperative is transforming the way we transition to a sustainable electricity grid
item.description: The Hague's smart microgrid at Scheveningen — known as Slim Strandnet — started in 2016, years before grid congestion became a national crisis. Today it runs on second-life EV batteries, circular solar panels, and an energy cooperative that puts energy justice at its core. Named top-3 government innovation in the Netherlands in 2025.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: The Construction Products Regulation and Digital Product Passports: What the Industry Needs to Know
item.description: The recast Construction Products Regulation (EU) 2024/3110 introduces a full Digital Product Passport framework in Chapter X. But when DPP obligations actually bite depends on harmonised standards and a delegated act that hasn't been adopted yet. Here's what the construction industry needs to know.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: The Expected ESPR Delegated Act on Textiles: What We Know So Far
item.description: The EU's Ecodesign for Sustainable Products Regulation is preparing its delegated act on textiles. With adoption expected around late 2026 or early 2027, what ecodesign requirements and DPP data should the industry prepare for?
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: Try the AI Tax → UBI Simulator: Model How Automation Could Fund a Basic Income
item.description: What if taxing AI-driven automation could fund a universal basic income? Our interactive simulator lets you set the policy parameters and see the numbers play out — revenue collected, monthly payments per citizen, and how it evolves year on year.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: Try the EDI Wallet Demo: A Privacy-First Digital Identity Wallet
item.description: See a self-sovereign identity wallet in practice. The EDI Wallet demo lets you receive verifiable credentials, store them, and present them with selective disclosure — following the eIDAS 2.0 framework.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: Try the Battery Passport Checker: Find Out if You Need a Battery Passport
item.description: Not sure if your company needs a Battery Passport under EU Regulation 2023/1542? Our interactive checker walks you through the key questions and generates a downloadable PDF report with your obligation status.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: The Art of Emergence: An Interactive Triangle Ecosystem
item.description: On our homepage lives an interactive ecosystem of triangles. Hover, drag, cluster, freeze, and share your creation. Here's how to use it — and why emergence matters for regenerative innovation.
item.author: Regen Studio

item.title: Try the DPP System Demo: A Full Digital Product Passport in Action
item.description: See what a complete DPP system looks like end-to-end. Our interactive demo traces Brazilian hardwood furniture from forest to finished product, with UNTP verifiable credentials and live ESPR compliance data.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: Insights from CircularTech Forum — The Global DPP Community Meets in Cologne
item.description: On September 22nd I joined the CircularTech Forum in Cologne — the event for the global DPP community. Here are 5 insights I walked away with, from 90% of EU products requiring DPPs to why being early is a superpower.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: What to Expect from the ESPR Working Plan 2025–2030?
item.description: The ESPR Working Plan 2025–2030 sets the order and tempo for ecodesign requirements across 22 product groups, each requiring a Digital Product Passport. Here’s what to expect and when.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: Talk to AI as if it's Trump
item.description: Having a conversation with ChatGPT is the same as whispering it in Donald Trump’s ear. A personal story about AI, privacy, and why we need mental models for digital self-defense — co-written with ChatGPT.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: Position Paper: Trusted Digital Product Passports
item.description: Regen Studio led the creation of a groundbreaking position paper on Trusted Digital Product Passports for FIDES, commissioned by the Dutch Blockchain Coalition — defining a shared vision for trust ecosystems in the circular economy.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: 10 Design Principles for Antifragile Regenerative Innovation Systems
item.description: Inspired by Nassim Nicholas Taleb’s Antifragile, we distilled 10 design principles that shape our approach to regenerative innovation systems — systems that don’t just withstand shocks, but grow stronger from them.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: A Custom Digital Innovation Process for The Hague's Living Lab Scheveningen
item.description: Municipal digital innovation requires a process built for government — one that accounts for procurement rules, GDPR obligations, political cycles, and the need to transfer ownership to a team that will maintain and scale what was built. Regen Studio designed exactly that for The Hague's EC-DISC. The CIO of the Information & Automation department formally adopted it as departmental policy. Here is how it works — and how to engage it.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva

item.title: Weaving Nature into Urban Design
item.description: By learning from and working with natural ecosystems, cities can build resilience, restore biodiversity, and create spaces that regenerate rather than deplete.
item.author: Regen Studio

item.title: Reimagining Cities as Regenerative Ecosystems
item.description: Ben Wilson’s Urban Jungle challenges us to rethink our relationship with urban environments, presenting cities as dynamic ecosystems capable of fostering biodiversity and resilience in harmony with humans and the built environment.
item.author: Yvo Hunink de Paiva
